intro: Licania cyathodes, commonly known as the sweet-scented licania, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically divided into five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white, followed by distinctive, cup-shaped fruits known as cyathodes. Licania cyathodes is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and fragrant blooms.
